page.title: 18ENERGY TYPE/USES NASH AREA
page.content: Energy requirements are confined to domestic and agricultural use, there being no industrial users. The choices are restricted as there is no gas main. The area is dependant on electricity for much of its domestic energy; cooking, lighting and domestic appliances; a few homes have solid fuel cooking ranges. The majority of homes use oil fired central heating, but since oil prices have soared several have converted to solid fuel, with the occasional one to bulk gas. On the farms energy mainly comes from 2 sources, diesel fuel for motive power and electricity for heating, lighting, milking etc. Current approximate costs: Oil 19.2p litre Coal Â£5.00 cwt Electricity 5.3p unit
